image.altText: A man and a woman, both wearing suit jackets.

props.synopsis: Australia's $230 billion sovereign wealth fund would retain its focus on making a return, and the government has pledged not to draw down on it for eight years.

title.children: Government directs $230 billion Future Fund to invest in housing and green energy

image.altText: A composite image of a ballerina and her parents shielding themselves with jackets

props.synopsis: The parents of a malnourished Perth teenager doctors warned would die without medical help have been found guilty of starving her.

title.children: Parents guilty of starving their emaciated teenage daughter who they treated like a 'little girl'

image.altText: Photo of a young woman with red hair and nose piercings

props.synopsis: A brief of evidence submitted to the Melbourne Magistrates Court outlines the police case against the man accused of her murder, and a second who allegedly helped the offender.

title.children: Police allege the fatal bashing of Isla Bell was captured on CCTV

image.altText: A black stone sign reading 'The United States of America' in English and Ukrainian in front of a silver fence and pale building

props.synopsis: The US embassy in Kyiv has closed after receiving information of a "potential significant air attack", the US Department of State Consular Affairs says.

title.children: US embassy in Kyiv closes over threat of air attack after Biden approves landmines for Ukraine

image.altText: Two men in suits shake hands in front of flags of Australia and China.

props.synopsis: As US President Joe Biden eyes an exit to the world stage, China's Xi Jinping made full use of the G20 to barnstorm his way through meetings with world leaders to stitch together relationships in anticipation of Donald Trump's return.

title.children: The APEC and G20 summits had a 97kg fake-tanned elephant hanging over them

image.altText: Hip hop group 3% on stage at the 2024 ARIA awards accepting an award

props.synopsis: First Nations artists win big at an ARIA Awards ceremony that celebrates the breadth of Australian music.

title.children: 'We're taking them all home': First Nations artists shine at 2024 ARIA Awards

image.altText: A screenshot from an ad showing an Indian couple taking a selfie near the MCG.

props.synopsis: Tourism Australia's mascot Ruby the Roo has a new batting partner in Australian cricket captain Pat Cummins, who stars alongside her in a multi-million-dollar campaign aimed at enticing more Indian travellers Down Under.

title.children: With visitors from China in decline, Australia's tourism industry is now trying to entice India

image.altText: Hawthorn Hawks logo outside Waverly Park

props.synopsis: Former premiership player Cyril Rioli was among the group of players who alleged they were subjected to a racist culture during their time at the club.

title.children: Hawthorn Football Club settles federal court case with Indigenous players

image.altText: A close up of Imran Khan in a black suit as he talks and gestures with his hand.

props.synopsis: It has not yet been confirmed if the embattled politician will be released from jail given he faces other cases too, including one accusing him of inciting violence against the state.

title.children: Pakistan's ex-PM Imran Khan granted bail in state gifts case, his party says

image.altText: AFL draftee Sam Lalor stands on stage holding a Richmond guernsey next to former Tigers captain Trent Cotchin.

props.synopsis: Shortly after becoming the number one pick in the 2024 AFL Draft, Sam Lalor did not shy away when asked whether he would like to take the number Dustin Martin made his own at Richmond.

title.children: 'I'd definitely like it': Richmond's top draft pick Sam Lalor hunting Dustin Martin's iconic number in debut season

image.altText: Large speakers on top of a hill.

props.synopsis: North Korea is blasting the sounds of screams, gunfire, bombs, and chilling music at the South Korean border, which some experts say almost amounts to "torture".

title.children: South Koreans despair over 'chilling' sounds blasted by North Korea at border

image.altText: Holly smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: The father of Melbourne 19-year-old Holly Bowles says his daughter remains on life support, as Holly and her friend Bianca Jones fight for their lives after drinking tainted alcohol in Laos while on a backpacking holiday.

title.children: Father of Melbourne teen hospitalised after suspected methanol poisoning thanks public for support

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek looks to the left while speaking in Question Time

props.synopsis: The move to strike down a fee on waste exports is another blow by the Senate to Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek.

title.children: 'Recycling tax' fee scrapped in Greens and Coalition manoeuvre

image.altText: A baby sits against a white background smiling wearing a white shirt and flowery pants

props.synopsis: A police officer who spoke with the mother of a baby who was killed by her father in a murder-suicide at the Whispering Wall in South Australia's Barossa Valley has broken down in tears as she described how she could have handled the file differently.

title.children: SA police officer breaks down during inquest into death of baby Kobi, saying she missed threats to kill in father's file

image.altText: Wind turbines across a field.

props.synopsis: The wind farm where a worker was killed last week recorded a separate safety incident in the weeks leading up to the fatality.

title.children: Safety incident occurred on wind farm in weeks leading up to fatal accident

image.altText: A man with glasses in a shirt looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Welsh American journalist Jon Ronson has interviewed conspiracy theorists, neo-Nazis and soldiers trained as psychics. This week, at his live shows, he'll teach you to spot a psychopath.

title.children: Jon Ronson will teach you how to spot a psychopath. Then he'll explain the dangers of labelling people

image.altText: Jimmy Lai

props.synopsis: Jimmy Lai, the billionaire Hong Kong media tycoon, has taken the stand in his own defence in a high-stakes national security trial that could see him jailed for life.

title.children: Billionaire Jimmy Lai questioned about Trump links during high-stakes trial in Hong Kong

image.altText: Passengers and platforms on the Sydney Train Network.

props.synopsis: Transport for NSW is "scrambling" to bring in replacement transport amid the Sydney trains shutdown this weekend. But why are workers striking and exactly what is the union demanding?

title.children: What the rail union is demanding to avert the Sydney train shutdown

image.altText: Kids playing in mud Lesdale

props.synopsis: Charleville in south-west Queensland has recorded 68.2mm of rain in one hour on Wednesday afternoon. The Weather Bureau says it's a highly unlikely event, with only a two per cent chance of that amount of rain falling in Charleville in any given year.

title.children: Intense downpour dumps 68.2mm on Charleville in an hour

image.altText: A side-on head and shoulders snapshot of a 66-year-old Caucasian man with grey hair, wearing glasses and a suit and tie

props.synopsis: The former Sunshine Coast celebrity will spend at least six months behind bars after being found guilty of child sex offences against a 13-year-old girl in 1988.

title.children: Former Queensland radio host Peter Lang jailed for historical child sex offences

image.altText: A large tree stump smashes through the front of a car windscreen with tree branches scattered on the bonnet

props.synopsis: A flash storm in the Pilbara town of Tom Price uproots trees, damages fences and forces businesses and schools into lockdown.

title.children: Storm creates 'utter chaos' in mining town as wild weather continues in WA

image.altText: The outside of the NAAJA building in Darwin.

props.synopsis: One of Australia's top Aboriginal legal services, NAAJA, has publicly apologised for the unlawful sacking of former chief executive officer Priscilla Atkins.

title.children: Aboriginal legal service NAAJA apologises for 'hurt' caused by unlawful sacking of CEO

image.altText: A man with graying beard

props.synopsis: Officers say they had no choice but to shoot when veteran Steven Angus, 52,  charged at them while holding two knives at a Townsville house in 2023.

title.children: Inquest into veteran's shooting hears police are grappling with 'suicide by cop' cases

image.altText: A close-up of someone wearing a camouflage US Marines uniform.

props.synopsis: A US marine attempting to sue his own government after he was "engulfed in flames" in a barbecue explosion while stationed in Darwin has had a ruling in his favour overturned on appeal.

title.children: US marine burned by exploding barbecue suffers appeal setback in lawsuit against own government

image.altText: Cockroaches crawling all over rows of concrete sheeting

props.synopsis: Seeing a cockroach scutter across your kitchen floor is off-putting for many Australians, but there are some things you can do to keep on top of them. And it's important to note, they can be beautiful.

title.children: Cockroaches are 'almost inescapable' when it's warm. Here's how to keep them at bay

image.altText: Ivona Jovanovic taking a selfie in a mirror in 2019

props.synopsis: A Gold Coast man previously charged over the death of his former partner has maintained his innocence despite being urged to "go deep into your heart" and be honest about how she died.

title.children: Ex-partner maintains innocence at inquest into Gold Coast woman's shooting death

image.altText: a man holds a photo of Mary Jane Veloso

props.synopsis: Philippine woman Mary Jane Veloso is to be transferred to a prison in her homeland after years of negotiations.

title.children: Filipina spared from Bali Nine firing squad to be returned home

image.altText: a man holding a flag in front of a giant missile on a truck

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin has signed a revised doctrine lowering the bar for Moscow's use of its atomic arsenal, including in response to conventional weapons. Does it change the likelihood of Russia using its nuclear capabilities?

title.children: Russia has revamped its nuclear policy. What now?

image.altText: the finger of a person hovering above a poker machine about to hit one of the buttons

props.synopsis: A day after Tasmania's government said it was pausing the introduction of a system designed to cap a gambler's losses to the pokies, the state's gaming commissioner says she hopes "common sense will prevail" and "something" is put into hotels and clubs to "support people".

title.children: 'Incredibly disappointing': Gaming commissioner pleads with Tasmanian government to continue with cashless card system

image.altText: A white silky bantam chicken.

props.synopsis: Peter William Smith removed the silky bantam chicken from an enclosure at a wildlife park earlier this year before tossing it into the alligator enclosure where it was eaten.

title.children: Grandfather who threw 'Betty White' the chicken to alligators at wildlife park spared jail

image.altText: A "sorry we're closed" sign in the window of a shopfront.

props.synopsis: The rate of business failures is now the highest it has been since the COVID-19 pandemic, and it is only set to grow as the cost of doing business squeezes companies from all sides.

title.children: Businesses are failing at near the highest rate on record

image.altText: A woman with red hair sits in an office with brightly coloured wallpaper behind her

props.synopsis: The prolific wallpaper designer reinvented herself many times and embroidered her biography. But years after her death, her murderer is still unknown.

title.children: Glamorous designer Florence Broadhurst's secrets came out at her funeral, but her killer remains unknown

image.altText: Lula, a shorter Brazilian man with a white beard, smiles as he poses for a picture with Joe Biden, both wearing suits

props.synopsis: Billionaires could be forced to pay a minimum rate of tax on their wealth after a global grouping of nations agrees to effectively tax the ultra-rich.

title.children: Brazil's president is trying to get billionaires taxed fairly — here's where he has got to so far

image.altText: Child holding hand

props.synopsis: Leading family violence advocates call for children to be directly involved in designing policy, and urgent investment in support services and training in an effort to prevent child abuse.

title.children: 'Stop failing the next generation of kids': New guide released for preventing child abuse
